      18             : // Define a reasonable default GC policy for GC-aware Maps.
      19             : template <typename Key, typename Value>
      20             : struct DefaultMapSweepPolicy {
      21       31334 :     static bool needsSweep(Key* key, Value* value) {
      22       52035 :         return GCPolicy<Key>::needsSweep(key) || GCPolicy<Value>::needsSweep(value);
      23             :     }
      24             : };
      25             : 
      26             : // A GCHashMap is a GC-aware HashMap, meaning that it has additional trace and
      27             : // sweep methods that know how to visit all keys and values in the table.
      28             : // HashMaps that contain GC pointers will generally want to use this GCHashMap
      29             : // specialization instead of HashMap, because this conveniently supports tracing
      30             : // keys and values, and cleaning up weak entries.
      31             : //
      32             : // GCHashMap::trace applies GCPolicy<T>::trace to each entry's key and value.
      33             : // Most types of GC pointers already have appropriate specializations of
      34             : // GCPolicy, so they should just work as keys and values. Any struct type with a
      35             : // default constructor and trace and sweep functions should work as well. If you
      36             : // need to define your own GCPolicy specialization, generic helpers can be found
      37             : // in js/public/TracingAPI.h.
      38             : //
      39             : // The MapSweepPolicy template parameter controls how the table drops entries
      40             : // when swept. GCHashMap::sweep applies MapSweepPolicy::needsSweep to each table
      41             : // entry; if it returns true, the entry is dropped. The default MapSweepPolicy
      42             : // drops the entry if either the key or value is about to be finalized,
      43             : // according to its GCPolicy<T>::needsSweep method. (This default is almost
      44             : // always fine: it's hard to imagine keeping such an entry around anyway.)
      45             : //
      46             : // Note that this HashMap only knows *how* to trace and sweep, but it does not
      47             : // itself cause tracing or sweeping to be invoked. For tracing, it must be used
      48             : // with Rooted or PersistentRooted, or barriered and traced manually. For
      49             : // sweeping, currently it requires an explicit call to <map>.sweep().
      50             : template <typename Key,
      51             :           typename Value,
      52             :           typename HashPolicy = js::DefaultHasher<Key>,
      53             :           typename AllocPolicy = js::TempAllocPolicy,
      54             :           typename MapSweepPolicy = DefaultMapSweepPolicy<Key, Value>>
      55       17076 : class GCHashMap : public js::HashMap<Key, Value, HashPolicy, AllocPolicy>
      56             : {
      57             :     using Base = js::HashMap<Key, Value, HashPolicy, AllocPolicy>;
      58             : 
      59             :   public:
      60        8478 :     explicit GCHashMap(AllocPolicy a = AllocPolicy()) : Base(a)  {}
      61             : 
      62             :     static void trace(GCHashMap* map, JSTracer* trc) { map->trace(trc); }
      63        5768 :     void trace(JSTracer* trc) {
      64       11536 :         if (!this->initialized())
      65        5768 :             return;
      66       12833 :         for (typename Base::Enum e(*this); !e.empty(); e.popFront()) {
      67        5331 :             GCPolicy<Value>::trace(trc, &e.front().value(), "hashmap value");
      68        3554 :             GCPolicy<Key>::trace(trc, &e.front().mutableKey(), "hashmap key");
      69             :         }
      70             :     }
      71             : 
      72       20720 :     void sweep() {
      73       41440 :         if (!this->initialized())
      74       20721 :             return;
      75             : 
      76      110252 :         for (typename Base::Enum e(*this); !e.empty(); e.popFront()) {
      77      376513 :             if (MapSweepPolicy::needsSweep(&e.front().mutableKey(), &e.front().value()))
      78       16902 :                 e.removeFront();
      79             :         }
      80             :     }
      81             : 
      82             :     // GCHashMap is movable
      83        1755 :     GCHashMap(GCHashMap&& rhs) : Base(mozilla::Move(rhs)) {}
      84             :     void operator=(GCHashMap&& rhs) {
      85             :         MOZ_ASSERT(this != &rhs, "self-move assignment is prohibited");
      86             :         Base::operator=(mozilla::Move(rhs));
      87             :     }
      88             : 
      89             :   private:
      90             :     // GCHashMap is not copyable or assignable
      91             :     GCHashMap(const GCHashMap& hm) = delete;
      92             :     GCHashMap& operator=(const GCHashMap& hm) = delete;
      93             : };
      94             :

      98             : 
      99             : // HashMap that supports rekeying.
     100             : //
     101             : // If your keys are pointers to something like JSObject that can be tenured or
     102             : // compacted, prefer to use GCHashMap with MovableCellHasher, which takes
     103             : // advantage of the Zone's stable id table to make rekeying unnecessary.
     104             : template <typename Key,
     105             :           typename Value,
     106             :           typename HashPolicy = DefaultHasher<Key>,
     107             :           typename AllocPolicy = TempAllocPolicy,
     108             :           typename MapSweepPolicy = JS::DefaultMapSweepPolicy<Key, Value>>

     110             : {

     216             : namespace JS {
     217             : 
     218             : // A GCHashSet is a HashSet with an additional trace method that knows
     219             : // be traced to be kept alive will generally want to use this GCHashSet
     220             : // specialization in lieu of HashSet.
     221             : //
     222             : // Most types of GC pointers can be traced with no extra infrastructure. For
     223             : // structs and non-gc-pointer members, ensure that there is a specialization of
     224             : // GCPolicy<T> with an appropriate trace method available to handle the custom
     225             : // type. Generic helpers can be found in js/public/TracingAPI.h.
     226             : //
     227             : // Note that although this HashSet's trace will deal correctly with moved
     228             : // elements, it does not itself know when to barrier or trace elements. To
     229             : // function properly it must either be used with Rooted or barriered and traced
     230             : // manually.
     231             : template <typename T,
     232             :           typename HashPolicy = js::DefaultHasher<T>,
     233             :           typename AllocPolicy = js::TempAllocPolicy>
     234       18340 : class GCHashSet : public js::HashSet<T, HashPolicy, AllocPolicy>
     235             : {
     236             :     using Base = js::HashSet<T, HashPolicy, AllocPolicy>;
     237             : 
     238             :   public:
     239        6030 :     explicit GCHashSet(AllocPolicy a = AllocPolicy()) : Base(a)  {}
     240             : 
     241             :     static void trace(GCHashSet* set, JSTracer* trc) { set->trace(trc); }
     242        3474 :     void trace(JSTracer* trc) {
     243        6948 :         if (!this->initialized())
     244        3474 :             return;
     245      128480 :         for (typename Base::Enum e(*this); !e.empty(); e.popFront())
     246      245944 :             GCPolicy<T>::trace(trc, &e.mutableFront(), "hashset element");
     247             :     }
     248             : 
     249       20080 :     void sweep() {
     250       40160 :         if (!this->initialized())
     251       20082 :             return;
     252      709116 :         for (typename Base::Enum e(*this); !e.empty(); e.popFront()) {
     253     2010470 :             if (GCPolicy<T>::needsSweep(&e.mutableFront()))
     254      127933 :                 e.removeFront();
     255             :         }
     256             :     }
     257             : 
     258             :     // GCHashSet is movable
     259        3260 :     GCHashSet(GCHashSet&& rhs) : Base(mozilla::Move(rhs)) {}
     260             :     void operator=(GCHashSet&& rhs) {
     261             :         MOZ_ASSERT(this != &rhs, "self-move assignment is prohibited");
     262             :         Base::operator=(mozilla::Move(rhs));
     263             :     }
     264             :
